description: {"blocks":[{"key":"80q3v","text":"Purification of Total RNA from Cells Using Spin Technology","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6h8fe","text":"Add 20μl β-ME per 1 ml Buffer RLT. Dispense in a fume hood. Buffer RLT containing β-ME can be stored at room temperature for up to 1 month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9nq6","text":"Add volumes of ethanol (96–100%) as indicated on the bottle to concentrate buffer RPE to obtain a working Solution.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fni2","text":" Harvest cells (do not use more than 1 x 107 cells)  To lyse cells directly in the cell-culture vessel (up to 10am diameter): Determine the number of cells. Completely aspirate the cell-culture medium, and proceed immediately to step 4.   To trypsinize and collect cells (Cells grown in cell-culture flasks should always be trypsinized): Determine the number of cells. Detach cells from the dish or flask using trypsin, add medium containing serum to inactivate the trypsin, transfer the cells to an RNase-free centrifuge tube, and centrifuge at 1200rpm for 5 min. Completely aspirate the supernatant, and proceed to step 4.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i1sh","text":"Disrupt the cells by adding Buffer RLT.  For direct lysis of cells: Add the appropriate volume of Buffer RLT as below to the cell-culture dish. Collect the lysate with cell scrapter. Pipet the lysate into a microcentrifuge tube. Vortex or pipet to mix, and ensure that no cell clumps are visible before proceeding to step 5.                                                                                                                                ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81ll3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6png6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7iuni","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2or9","text":"For pelleted cells: Loosen the cell pellet thoroughly by flicking the tube. Add the appropriate volume of Buffer RLT as below. Pipet to mix, and proceed to step 5. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0f6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b01gk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dpif2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["159","219"],"data":[["Dish diameter (cm)                                   ","Volume of Buffer RLT (μl)"],["\u003c6                                                         ","350"],["6-10","600"]],"guid":"D24BD752502B47F389AB1F85EDF1E321","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Dish diameter (cm)                                   ","Volume of Buffer RLT (μl)"],["\u003c6                                                         ","350"],["6-10","600"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["202","202"],"data":[["Number of pelleted cells ","Volume of Buffer RLT (μl)  "],["    \u003c5 x 10^6","350"],["5x 10^6 – 1 x 10^7","600"]],"guid":"60AC713F42AD46D38F418FA6A827A28E","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Number of pelleted cells ","Volume of Buffer RLT (μl)  "],["    \u003c5 x 10^6","350"],["5x 10^6 – 1 x 10^7","600"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eakbh","text":"Homogenize the lysate.  Pipet the lysate directly into a QIAshredder spin column placed in a 2 ml collection tube,    and centrifuge for 2 min at full speed.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1runv","text":" Add 1 volume of 70% ethanol to the homogenized lysate, and mix well by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0hve","text":"Transfer up to 700 μl of the sample, including any precipitate that may have formed, to an RNeasy spin column placed in a 2 ml collection tube. Close the lid gently, and  centrifuge for 15 s at 10,000 rpm. Discard the flow-through  If the sample volume exceeds 700 μl, centrifuge successive aliquots in the same RNeasy spin column.  Discard the flow-through after each centrifugation.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":232,"length":153}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7g7og","text":"Add 700 μl Buffer RW1 to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently, and centrifuge for 15 s at 10,000 rpm to wash the spin column membrane. Discard the flow-through","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qdn2","text":"Add 500 μl Buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently, and centrifuge for 15 s at 10,000 rpm to wash the spin column membrane. Discard the flow-through.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dca41","text":"Place the RNeasy spin column in a new 1.5 ml collection tube. Add 30–50 μl RNase-free water directly to the spin column membrane. Close the lid gently, and centrifuge for 1 min at 10,000 rpm to elute the RNA.    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8klvn","text":"Always wear gloves and spray with RNaseZap and spread solution all over gloves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vmfs","text":"Cell pellets can be stored at –70°C for later use or used directly in the procedure. Frozen cell pellets should be thawed slightly so that they can be dislodged by flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5m5ci","text":"Homogenized cell lysates from step 5 can be stored at –70°C for several months. Frozen lysates should be incubated at 37°C in a water bath until completely thawed and salts are dissolved. Avoid prolonged incubation, which may compromise RNA integrity. If any insoluble material is visible, centrifuge for 5 min at 3000–5000 x g. Transfer supernatant to a new RNase-free glass or polypropylene tube, and continue with step 6.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"db9nf","text":"Perform all steps of the procedure at room temperature. During the procedure, work quickly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20bqv","text":"Perform all centrifugation steps at 20–25°C in a standard microcentrifuge. Ensure that the centrifuge does not cool below 20°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Purification of Total RNA from Cells Using Spin Technology
